Cvars.name: showbudget_texture_global_dumpstats
Cvars.help: Dump all items in +showbudget_texture_global in a text form

Cvars.name: name2
Cvars.help: Current user name

Cvars.name: sc_haptics_stick_intensity2
Cvars.help: Strength of stick emulation haptics

Cvars.name: sc_haptics_stick_mode2
Cvars.help: What type of haptics to perform for stick emulation

Cvars.name: sc_haptics_trackball_tick_intensity2
Cvars.help: Strength of view ticks

Cvars.name: sc_haptics_trackball_tick_interval2
Cvars.help: Distance traveled per haptic tick

Cvars.name: sc_haptics2
Cvars.help: Do haptic feedback on steam controller.

Cvars.name: sc_accel_exponent2
Cvars.help: Steam Controller look acceleration exponent

Cvars.name: sc_accel_scale2
Cvars.help: Steam Controller look acceleration scale

Cvars.name: sc_look_pad2
Cvars.help: Which pad controls 1:1 look - 0 = off, 1 = left, 2 = right

Cvars.name: sc_momentum_minimum2
Cvars.help: Velocities below this value will not impart momentum

Cvars.name: sc_momentum_decay2
Cvars.help: Steamcontroller momentum decay half life

Cvars.name: sc_yaw_bias2
Cvars.help: SteamController momentum yaw bias blends away pitch based on the degree of yaw momentum.

Cvars.name: sc_jitter_mode2
Cvars.help: Steam Controller - the jitter prevention mode, 0 clamps, 1 filters

Cvars.name: sc_jitter_threshold2
Cvars.help: Steam Controller - any movement under this threshold will filtered to prevent jitter

Cvars.name: sc_pitch_sensitivity2
Cvars.help: SteamController pitch factor.

Cvars.name: sc_yaw_sensitivity2
Cvars.help: SteamController yaw factor.

Cvars.name: sc_enable2
Cvars.help: Enable SteamController

Cvars.name: cl_mouselook2
Cvars.help: Set to 1 to use mouse for look, 0 for keyboard look. Cannot be set while connected to a server.

Cvars.name: m_pitch2
Cvars.help: Mouse pitch factor.

Cvars.name: joy_movement_stick2
Cvars.help: Which stick controls movement (0 is left stick)

Cvars.name: joy_vibration2
Cvars.help: Controller vibration.

Cvars.name: joy_inverty2
Cvars.help: Whether to invert the Y axis of the joystick for looking.

Cvars.name: joy_invertx2
Cvars.help: Whether to invert the X axis of the joystick for looking.

Cvars.name: joy_legacy2
Cvars.help: Turn on/off 'Legacy' mapping for control sticks.

Cvars.name: cl_rumblescale2
Cvars.help: Scale sensitivity of rumble effects (0 to 1.0)

Cvars.name: sv_benchmark_numticks
Cvars.help: If > 0, then it only runs the benchmark for this # of ticks.

Cvars.name: sv_benchmark_autovprofrecord
Cvars.help: If running a benchmark and this is set, it will record a vprof file over the duration of the benchmark with filename benchmark.vprof.

Cvars.name: sv_benchmark_force_start
Cvars.help: Force start the benchmark. This is only for debugging. It's better to set sv_benchmark to 1 and restart the level.

Cvars.name: sv_infinite_ammo
Cvars.help: Player's active weapon will never run out of ammo

Cvars.name: sv_showanimstate
Cvars.help: Show the (server) animation state for the specified entity (-1 for none).

Cvars.name: sv_showanimstate_log
Cvars.help: 1 to output sv_showanimstate to Msg(). 2 to store in AnimStateServer.log. 3 for both.

Cvars.name: sv_showanimstate_activities
Cvars.help: Show activities in the (server) animation state display.

Cvars.name: item_show_whitelistable_definitions
Cvars.help: Lists the item definitions that can be whitelisted in the item_whitelist.txt file in tournament mode.

Cvars.name: sv_showladders
Cvars.help: Show bbox and dismount points for all ladders (must be set before level load.)

Cvars.name: gamestats_file_output_directory
Cvars.help: When -gamestatsfileoutputonly is specified, file will be emitted here instead of to modpath

Cvars.name: _resetgamestats
Cvars.help: Erases current game stats and writes out a blank stats file

Cvars.name: dumpgamestringtable
Cvars.help: Dump the contents of the game string table to the console.

Cvars.name: tsp_lightstyle
Cvars.help: Test

Cvars.name: sv_clearhinthistory
Cvars.help: Clear memory of server side hints displayed to the player.

Cvars.name: tv_delaymapchange
Cvars.help: Delays map change until broadcast is complete

Cvars.name: mp_restartgame
Cvars.help: If non-zero, game will restart in the specified number of seconds

Cvars.name: mp_waitingforplayers_time
Cvars.help: WaitingForPlayers time length in seconds

Cvars.name: mp_waitingforplayers_restart
Cvars.help: Set to 1 to start or restart the WaitingForPlayers period.

Cvars.name: mp_waitingforplayers_cancel
Cvars.help: Set to 1 to end the WaitingForPlayers period.

Cvars.name: mp_clan_readyrestart
Cvars.help: If non-zero, game will restart once someone from each team gives the ready signal

Cvars.name: mp_clan_ready_signal
Cvars.help: Text that team leader from each team must speak for the match to begin

Cvars.name: nextlevel
Cvars.help: If set to a valid map name, will change to this map during the next changelevel

Cvars.name: particle_test_file
Cvars.help: Name of the particle system to dynamically spawn

Cvars.name: particle_test_attach_mode
Cvars.help: Possible Values: 'start_at_attachment', 'follow_attachment', 'start_at_origin', 'follow_origin'

Cvars.name: particle_test_attach_attachment
Cvars.help: Attachment index for attachment mode

Cvars.name: particle_test_start
Cvars.help:
Dispatches the test particle system with the parameters specified in particle_test_file,
 particle_test_attach_mode and particle_test_attach_param on the entity the player is looking at.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: particle_test_stop
Cvars.help:
Stops all particle systems on the selected entities.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: debug_touchlinks
Cvars.help: Spew touch link activity

Cvars.name: sv_thinktimecheck
Cvars.help: Check for thinktimes all on same timestamp.

Cvars.name: mp_dump_server_completion_data
Cvars.help: Prints player completion data for all maps.

Cvars.name: mp_earn_taunt
Cvars.help: Unlocks, owns, and puts a taunt in the gesture wheel.

Cvars.name: mp_lock_taunt
Cvars.help: Locks a taunt and removes it from the gesture wheel.

Cvars.name: mp_lock_all_taunts
Cvars.help: Locks all available taunts and removes them from the gesture wheel.

Cvars.name: mp_mark_all_maps_complete
Cvars.help: Marks all levels as complete in the save file.

Cvars.name: mp_mark_all_maps_incomplete
Cvars.help: Marks all levels as incomplete in the save file.

Cvars.name: mp_mark_course_complete
Cvars.help: Marks all levels in a branch as complete in the save file.

Cvars.name: sv_use_bendy_model
Cvars.help: Use the bendy stick-man as the player model

Cvars.name: debug_fixmyposition
Cvars.help: Runs FindsClosestPassableSpace() on player.

Cvars.name: sv_disable_querycache
Cvars.help: debug - disable trace query cache

Cvars.name: sv_querycache_stats
Cvars.help: Display status of the query cache (client only)

Cvars.name: sv_regeneration_force_on
Cvars.help: Cheat to test regenerative health systems

Cvars.name: cc_norepeat
Cvars.help: In multiplayer games, don't repeat captions more often than this many seconds.

Cvars.name: sv_soundemitter_flush
Cvars.help: Flushes the sounds.txt system (server only)

Cvars.name: sv_soundemitter_filecheck
Cvars.help: Report missing wave files for sounds and game_sounds files.

Cvars.name: sv_soundemitter_reload
Cvars.help: Flushes the sounds.txt system

Cvars.name: sv_findsoundname
Cvars.help: Find sound names which reference the specified wave files.

Cvars.name: sv_soundemitter_spew
Cvars.help: Print details about a sound.

Cvars.name: report_soundpatch
Cvars.help: reports sound patch count

Cvars.name: sv_alltalk
Cvars.help: Players can hear all other players, no team restrictions

Cvars.name: script
Cvars.help: Run the text as a script

Cvars.name: script_execute
Cvars.help: Run a vscript file

Cvars.name: script_debug
Cvars.help: Connect the vscript VM to the script debugger

Cvars.name: script_help
Cvars.help: Output help for script functions, optionally with a search string

Cvars.name: script_dump_all
Cvars.help: Dump the state of the VM to the console

Cvars.name: ai_debug_expressions
Cvars.help: Show random expression decisions for NPCs.

Cvars.name: scene_showfaceto
Cvars.help: When playing back, show the directions of faceto events.

Cvars.name: scene_clamplookat
Cvars.help: Clamp head turns to a MAX of 20 degrees per think.

Cvars.name: rr_remarkable_world_entities_replay_limit
Cvars.help: TLK_REMARKs will be dispatched no more than this many times for any given info_remarkable

Cvars.name: rr_remarkables_enabled
Cvars.help: If 1, polling for info_remarkables and issuances of TLK_REMARK is enabled.

Cvars.name: rr_remarkable_max_distance
Cvars.help: AIs will not even consider remarkarbles that are more than this many units away.

Cvars.name: ai_debug_dyninteractions
Cvars.help: Debug the NPC dynamic interaction system.

Cvars.name: ai_frametime_limit
Cvars.help: frametime limit for min efficiency AIE_NORMAL (in sec's).

Cvars.name: sv_test_scripted_sequences
Cvars.help: Tests for scripted sequences that are embedded in the world. Run through your map with this set to check for NPCs falling through the world.

Cvars.name: ai_disable
Cvars.help: Bi-passes all AI logic routines and puts all NPCs into their idle animations.  Can be used to get NPCs out of your way and to test effect of AI logic routines on frame rate

Cvars.name: ai_setenabled
Cvars.help: Like ai_disable but you manually specify the state (with a 0 or 1) instead of toggling it.

Cvars.name: ai_show_hints
Cvars.help:
Displays all hints as small boxes
	Blue		- hint is available for use
	Red		- hint is currently being used by an NPC
	Orange		- hint not being used by timed out
	Grey		- hint has been disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_hull
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed hulls between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Arguments: 	-none-

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect_jump
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect_fly
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect_crawl
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_grid
Cvars.help: Draw a grid on the floor where looking.

Cvars.name: ai_step
Cvars.help: NPCs will freeze after completing their current task.  To complete the next task, use 'ai_step' again.  To resume processing normally use 'ai_resume'

Cvars.name: ai_resume
Cvars.help: If NPC is stepping through tasks (see ai_step ) will resume normal processing.

Cvars.name: ai_next_hull
Cvars.help:
Cycles through the various hull sizes.  Currently selected hull size is written to the screen.  Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used
	Arguments:	-none-

Cvars.name: ai_hull
Cvars.help:
Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used
	Arguments:	NPC name or classname, <none>=NPC under crosshair

Cvars.name: ai_nodes
Cvars.help:
Toggles node display.  First call displays the nodes for the given network as green objects.  Second call  displays the nodes and their IDs.  Nodes are color coded as follows:
	Green		- ground node
	Cyan		- air node
	Magenta	- climb node
	Grey		- node not available for selected hull size
	Orange 	- node currently locked

Cvars.name: ai_show_node
Cvars.help: Highlight the specified node

Cvars.name: ai_show_visibility
Cvars.help: Toggles visibility display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are visible from the selected node will be drawn in red with yellow lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not visible from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

Cvars.name: ai_show_graph_connect
Cvars.help: Toggles graph connection display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are connected to the selected node by the net graph will be drawn in red with magenta lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not connected via the net graph from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

Cvars.name: npc_bipass
Cvars.help:
Displays the local movement attempts by the given NPC(s) (triangulation detours).  Failed bypass routes are displayed in red, successful bypasses are shown in green.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at.

Cvars.name: npc_destroy
Cvars.help:
Removes the given NPC(s) from the universe
Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc_class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_kill
Cvars.help:
Kills the given NPC(s)
Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc_class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_enemies
Cvars.help:
Shows memory of NPC.  Draws an X on top of each memory.
	Eluded entities drawn in blue (don't know where it went)
	Unreachable entities drawn in green (can't get to it)
	Current enemy drawn in red
	Current target entity drawn in magenta
	All other entities drawn in pink
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_focus
Cvars.help:
Displays red line to NPC's enemy (if has one) and blue line to NPC's target entity (if has one)
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_create
Cvars.help:
Creates an NPC of the given type where the player is looking (if the given NPC can actually stand at that location).  
	Arguments:	[npc_class_name] [name of npc (optional) ] [addon type (optional) ] [name of addon (optional) ]

Cvars.name: npc_create_aimed
Cvars.help:
Creates an NPC aimed away from the player of the given type where the player is looking (if the given NPC can actually stand at that location).  Note that this only works for npc classes that are already in the world.  You can not create an entity that doesn't have an instance in the level.
	Arguments:	{npc_class_name}

Cvars.name: npc_destroy_unselected
Cvars.help: Removes all NPCs from the universe that aren't currently selected

Cvars.name: npc_freeze
Cvars.help:
Selected NPC(s) will freeze in place (or unfreeze). If there are no selected NPCs, uses the NPC under the crosshair.
	Arguments:	-none-

Cvars.name: npc_set_freeze
Cvars.help:
Selected NPC(s) will freeze in place (or unfreeze). If there are no selected NPCs, uses the NPC under the crosshair.
	Arguments:	-none-

Cvars.name: npc_freeze_unselected
Cvars.help: Freeze all NPCs not selected

Cvars.name: npc_set_freeze_unselected
Cvars.help: Freeze all NPCs not selected

Cvars.name: npc_thinknow
Cvars.help: Trigger NPC to think

Cvars.name: npc_teleport
Cvars.help:
Selected NPC will teleport to the location that the player is looking (shown with a purple box)
	Arguments:	-none-

Cvars.name: npc_go_do_run
Cvars.help: Set whether should run on NPC go

Cvars.name: npc_go
Cvars.help:
Selected NPC(s) will go to the location that the player is looking (shown with a purple box)
	Arguments:	-none-

Cvars.name: npc_go_random
Cvars.help:
Sends all selected NPC(s) to a random node.
	Arguments:   	-none-

Cvars.name: npc_reset
Cvars.help:
Reloads schedules for all NPC's from their script files
	Arguments:	-none-

Cvars.name: npc_nearest
Cvars.help:
Draw's a while box around the NPC(s) nearest node
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_route
Cvars.help:
Displays the current route of the given NPC as a line on the screen.  Waypoints along the route are drawn as small cyan rectangles.  Line is color coded in the following manner:
	Blue	- path to a node
	Cyan	- detour around an object (triangulation)
	Red	- jump
	Maroon - path to final target position
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc_class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_select
Cvars.help:
Select or deselects the given NPC(s) for later manipulation.  Selected NPC's are shown surrounded by a red translucent box
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_combat
Cvars.help:
Displays text debugging information about the squad and enemy of the selected NPC  (See Overlay Text)
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_squads
Cvars.help: Obsolete.  Replaced by npc_combat

Cvars.name: npc_tasks
Cvars.help:
Displays detailed text debugging information about the all the tasks of the selected NPC current schedule (See Overlay Text)
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_task_text
Cvars.help:
Outputs text debugging information to the console about the all the tasks + break conditions of the selected NPC current schedule
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_conditions
Cvars.help:
Displays all the current AI conditions that an NPC has in the overlay text.
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_viewcone
Cvars.help:
Displays the viewcone of the NPC (where they are currently looking and what the extents of there vision is)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_relationships
Cvars.help:
Displays the relationships between this NPC and all others.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_steering
Cvars.help:
Displays the steering obstructions of the NPC (used to perform local avoidance)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: npc_steering_all
Cvars.help: Displays the steering obstructions of all NPCs (used to perform local avoidance)

Cvars.name: npc_heal
Cvars.help: Heals the target back to full health

Cvars.name: npc_ammo_deplete
Cvars.help: Subtracts half of the target's ammo

Cvars.name: ai_clear_bad_links
Cvars.help: Clears bits set on nav links indicating link is unusable

Cvars.name: ai_test_los
Cvars.help: Test AI LOS from the player's POV

Cvars.name: ainet_generate_report
Cvars.help: Generate a report to the console.

Cvars.name: ainet_generate_report_only
Cvars.help: Generate a report to the console.

Cvars.name: ai_debug_eventresponses
Cvars.help: Set to 1 to see all NPC response events trigger, and which NPCs choose to respond to them.

Cvars.name: chet_debug_idle
Cvars.help: If set one, many debug prints to help track down the TLK_IDLE issue. Set two for super verbose info

Cvars.name: rr_forceconcept
Cvars.help:
fire a response concept directly at a given character.
USAGE: rr_forceconcept <target> <concept> "criteria1:value1,criteria2:value2,..."
criteria values are optional.

Cvars.name: ai_drop_hint
Cvars.help: Drop an ai_hint at the player's current eye position.

Cvars.name: ai_set_move_height_epsilon
Cvars.help: Set how high AI bumps up ground walkers when checking steps

Cvars.name: ai_nav_debug_experimental_pathing
Cvars.help: Draw paths tried during search for bodysnatcher pathing

Cvars.name: ai_debug_node_connect
Cvars.help: Debug the attempted connection between two nodes

Cvars.name: g_ai_threadedgraphbuild
Cvars.help: If true, use experimental threaded node graph building.

Cvars.name: sk_ally_regen_time
Cvars.help: Time taken for an ally to regenerate a point of health.

Cvars.name: sv_npc_talker_maxdist
Cvars.help: NPCs over this distance from the player won't attempt to speak.

Cvars.name: rr_debug_qa
Cvars.help: Set to 1 to see debug related to the Question & Answer system used to create conversations between allied NPCs.

Cvars.name: rr_reloadresponsesystems
Cvars.help: Reload all response system scripts.

Cvars.name: npc_speakall
Cvars.help: Force the npc to try and speak all their responses

Cvars.name: rr_followup_maxdist
Cvars.help: 'then ANY' or 'then ALL' response followups will be dispatched only to characters within this distance.

Cvars.name: rr_thenany_score_slop
Cvars.help: When computing respondents for a 'THEN ANY' rule, all rule-matching scores within this much of the best score will be considered.

Cvars.name: npc_height_adjust
Cvars.help: Enable test mode for ik height adjustment

Cvars.name: sv_pvsskipanimation
Cvars.help: Skips SetupBones when npc's are outside the PVS

Cvars.name: ai_setupbones_debug
Cvars.help: Shows that bones that are setup every think

Cvars.name: sv_netvisdist
Cvars.help: Test networking visibility distance

Cvars.name: ent_show_contexts
Cvars.help: Show entity contexts in ent_text display

Cvars.name: ai_debug_los
Cvars.help: NPC Line-Of-Sight debug mode. If 1, solid entities that block NPC LOC will be highlighted with white bounding boxes. If 2, it'll show non-solid entities that would do it if they were solid.

Cvars.name: ent_messages_draw
Cvars.help: Visualizes all entity input/output activity.

Cvars.name: ent_text
Cvars.help:
Displays text debugging information about the given entity(ies) on top of the entity (See Overlay Text)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_script_dump
Cvars.help:
Dumps the names and values of this entity's script scope to the console
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_bbox
Cvars.help:
Displays the movement bounding box for the given entity(ies) in orange.  Some entites will also display entity specific overlays.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_absbox
Cvars.help:
Displays the total bounding box for the given entity(s) in green.  Some entites will also display entity specific overlays.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_rbox
Cvars.help:
Displays the total bounding box for the given entity(s) in green.  Some entites will also display entity specific overlays.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_attachments
Cvars.help:
Displays the attachment points on an entity.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_viewoffset
Cvars.help:
Displays the eye position for the given entity(ies) in red.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_remove
Cvars.help:
Removes the given entity(s)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_remove_all
Cvars.help:
Removes all entities of the specified type
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name}

Cvars.name: ent_setname
Cvars.help:
Sets the targetname of the given entity(s)
	Arguments:   	{new entity name} {entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: find_ent
Cvars.help:
Find and list all entities with classnames or targetnames that contain the specified substring.
Format: find_ent <substring>

Cvars.name: find_ent_index
Cvars.help:
Display data for entity matching specified index.
Format: find_ent_index <index>

Cvars.name: ent_dump
Cvars.help:
Usage:
   ent_dump <entity name>

Cvars.name: ent_fire
Cvars.help:
Usage:
   ent_fire <target> [action] [value] [delay]

Cvars.name: ent_cancelpendingentfires
Cvars.help: Cancels all ent_fire created outputs that are currently waiting for their delay to expire.

Cvars.name: ent_info
Cvars.help:
Usage:
   ent_info <class name>

Cvars.name: ent_messages
Cvars.help:
Toggles input/output message display for the selected entity(ies).  The name of the entity will be displayed as well as any messages that it sends or receives.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_pause
Cvars.help: Toggles pausing of input/output message processing for entities.  When turned on processing of all message will stop.  Any messages displayed with 'ent_messages' will stop fading and be displayed indefinitely. To step through the messages one by one use 'ent_step'.

Cvars.name: picker
Cvars.help:
Toggles 'picker' mode.  When picker is on, the bounding box, pivot and debugging text is displayed for whatever entity the player is looking at.
	Arguments:	full - enables all debug information

Cvars.name: ent_pivot
Cvars.help:
Displays the pivot for the given entity(ies).
	(y=up=green, z=forward=blue, x=left=red). 
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_step
Cvars.help: When 'ent_pause' is set this will step through one waiting input / output message at a time.

Cvars.name: ent_show_response_criteria
Cvars.help:
Print, to the console, an entity's current criteria set used to select responses.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_autoaim
Cvars.help:
Displays the entity's autoaim radius.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Cvars.name: ent_create
Cvars.help: Creates an entity of the given type where the player is looking.

Cvars.name: ent_teleport
Cvars.help:
Teleport the specified entity to where the player is looking.
	Format: ent_teleport <entity name>

Cvars.name: ent_orient
Cvars.help:
Orient the specified entity to match the player's angles. By default, only orients target entity's YAW. Use the 'allangles' option to orient on all axis.
	Format: ent_orient <entity name> <optional: allangles>

Cvars.name: scene_showlook
Cvars.help: When playing back, show the directions of look events.

Cvars.name: scene_showmoveto
Cvars.help: When moving, show the end location.

Cvars.name: scene_showunlock
Cvars.help: Show when a vcd is playing but normal AI is running.

Cvars.name: ai_expression_optimization
Cvars.help: Disable npc background expressions when you can't see them.

Cvars.name: ai_expression_frametime
Cvars.help: Maximum frametime to still play background expressions.

Cvars.name: sv_allchat
Cvars.help: Players can receive all other players' text chat, no death restrictions

Cvars.name: tf_escort_score_rate
Cvars.help: Score for escorting the train, in points per second

Cvars.name: dumpeventqueue
Cvars.help: Dump the contents of the Entity I/O event queue to the console.

Cvars.name: cast_ray
Cvars.help: Tests collision detection

Cvars.name: cast_hull
Cvars.help: Tests hull collision detection

Cvars.name: drawline
Cvars.help:
Draws line between two 3D Points.
	Green if no collision
	Red is collides with something
	Arguments: x1 y1 z1 x2 y2 z2

Cvars.name: drawcross
Cvars.help:
Draws a cross at the given location
	Arguments: x y z

Cvars.name: kill
Cvars.help: Kills the player with generic damage

Cvars.name: explode
Cvars.help: Kills the player with explosive damage

Cvars.name: killvector
Cvars.help: Kills a player applying force. Usage: killvector <player> <x value> <y value> <z value>

Cvars.name: explodevector
Cvars.help: Kills a player applying an explosive force. Usage: explodevector <player> <x value> <y value> <z value>

Cvars.name: buddha
Cvars.help: Toggle.  Player takes damage but won't die. (Shows red cross when health is zero)

Cvars.name: say
Cvars.help: Display player message

Cvars.name: say_team
Cvars.help: Display player message to team

Cvars.name: give
Cvars.help:
Give item to player.
	Arguments: <item_name>

Cvars.name: setmodel
Cvars.help: Changes's player's model

Cvars.name: test_dispatcheffect
Cvars.help:
Test a clientside dispatch effect.
	Usage: test_dispatcheffect <effect name> <distance away> <flags> <magnitude> <scale>
	Defaults are: <distance 1024> <flags 0> <magnitude 0> <scale 0>

Cvars.name: bug_swap
Cvars.help: Automatically swaps the current weapon for the bug bait and back again.

Cvars.name: use
Cvars.help:
Use a particular weapon	
Arguments: <weapon_name>

Cvars.name: noclip
Cvars.help: Toggle. Player becomes non-solid and flies.  Optional argument of 0 or 1 to force enable/disable

Cvars.name: god
Cvars.help: Toggle. Player becomes invulnerable.

Cvars.name: ent_setpos
Cvars.help: Move entity to position

Cvars.name: ent_setang
Cvars.help: Set entity angles

Cvars.name: setpos
Cvars.help: Move player to specified origin (must have sv_cheats).

Cvars.name: setpos_player
Cvars.help: Move specified player to specified origin (must have sv_cheats).

Cvars.name: setang
Cvars.help: Snap player eyes to specified pitch yaw <roll:optional> (must have sv_cheats).

Cvars.name: setpos_exact
Cvars.help: Move player to an exact specified origin (must have sv_cheats).

Cvars.name: setang_exact
Cvars.help: Snap player eyes and orientation to specified pitch yaw <roll:optional> (must have sv_cheats).

Cvars.name: notarget
Cvars.help: Toggle. Player becomes hidden to NPCs.

Cvars.name: hurtme
Cvars.help:
Hurts the player.
	Arguments: <health to lose>

Cvars.name: groundlist
Cvars.help: Display ground entity list <index>

Cvars.name: commentary_available
Cvars.help: Automatically set by the game when a commentary file is available for the current map.

Cvars.name: commentary
Cvars.help: Desired commentary mode state.

Cvars.name: test_entity_blocker
Cvars.help: Test command that drops an entity blocker out in front of the player.

Cvars.name: respawn_entities
Cvars.help: Respawn all the entities in the map.

Cvars.name: report_entities
Cvars.help: Lists all entities

Cvars.name: report_touchlinks
Cvars.help: Lists all touchlinks

Cvars.name: report_simthinklist
Cvars.help: Lists all simulating/thinking entities

Cvars.name: ent_keyvalue
Cvars.help:
Applies the comma delimited key=value pairs to the entity with the given Hammer ID.
	Format: ent_keyvalue <entity id> <key1>=<value1>,<key2>=<value2>,...,<keyN>=<valueN>

Cvars.name: fadeout
Cvars.help: fadeout {time r g b}: Fades the screen to black or to the specified color over the given number of seconds.

Cvars.name: fadein
Cvars.help: fadein {time r g b}: Fades the screen in from black or from the specified color over the given number of seconds.

Cvars.name: shake
Cvars.help: Shake the screen.

Cvars.name: fx_new_sparks
Cvars.help: Use new style sparks.

Cvars.name: dbghist_addline
Cvars.help: Add a line to the debug history. Format: <category id> <line>

Cvars.name: dbghist_dump
Cvars.help:
Dump the debug history to the console. Format: <category id>
    Categories:
     0: Entity I/O
     1: AI Decisions
     2: Scene Print
     3: Alyx Blind
     4: Log of damage done to player

Cvars.name: mat_hdr_tonemapscale
Cvars.help: The HDR tonemap scale. 1 = Use autoexposure, 0 = eyes fully closed, 16 = eyes wide open.

Cvars.name: fish_dormant
Cvars.help: Turns off interactive fish behavior. Fish become immobile and unresponsive.

Cvars.name: fog_volume_debug
Cvars.help: If enabled, prints diagnostic information about the current fog volume

Cvars.name: foundry_update_entity
Cvars.help: Updates the entity's position/angles when in edit mode

Cvars.name: foundry_sync_hammer_view
Cvars.help: Move Hammer's 3D view to the same position as the engine's 3D view.

Cvars.name: foundry_engine_get_mouse_control
Cvars.help: Give the engine control of the mouse.

Cvars.name: foundry_engine_release_mouse_control
Cvars.help: Give the control of the mouse back to Hammer.

Cvars.name: foundry_select_entity
Cvars.help: Select the entity under the crosshair or select entities with the specified name.

Cvars.name: mapcyclefile
Cvars.help: Name of the .txt file used to cycle the maps on multiplayer servers

Cvars.name: sv_force_transmit_ents
Cvars.help: Will transmit all entities to client, regardless of PVS conditions (will still skip based on transmit flags, however).

Cvars.name: sv_showhitboxes
Cvars.help: Send server-side hitboxes for specified entity to client (NOTE:  this uses lots of bandwidth, use on listen server only).

Cvars.name: motdfile
Cvars.help: The MOTD file to load.

Cvars.name: hostfile
Cvars.help: The HOST file to load.

Cvars.name: give_promo_helmet
Cvars.help: Gives the gamestop promo helmets for coop bots. Requires a respawn or changelevel to start showing.

Cvars.name: dump_globals
Cvars.help: Dump all global entities/states

Cvars.name: server_game_time
Cvars.help: Gives the game time in seconds (server's curtime)

Cvars.name: global_event_log_enabled
Cvars.help: Enables the global event log system

Cvars.name: ai_debug_actbusy
Cvars.help:
Used to debug actbusy behavior. Usage:
1: Constantly draw lines from NPCs to the actbusy nodes they've chosen to actbusy at.
2: Whenever an NPC makes a decision to use an actbusy, show which actbusy they've chosen.
3: Selected NPCs (with npc_select) will report why they're not choosing actbusy nodes.
4: Display debug output of actbusy logic.
5: Display safe zone volumes and info.

Cvars.name: tv_delay
Cvars.help: SourceTV broadcast delay in seconds

Cvars.name: tv_allow_static_shots
Cvars.help: Auto director uses fixed level cameras for shots

Cvars.name: tv_allow_camera_man
Cvars.help: Auto director allows spectators to become camera man

Cvars.name: global_set
Cvars.help: global_set <globalname> <state>: Sets the state of the given env_global (0 = OFF, 1 = ON, 2 = DEAD).

Cvars.name: nav_split_place_on_ground
Cvars.help: If true, nav areas will be placed flush with the ground when split.

Cvars.name: nav_area_bgcolor
Cvars.help: RGBA color to draw as the background color for nav areas while editing.

Cvars.name: nav_corner_adjust_adjacent
Cvars.help: radius used to raise/lower corners in nearby areas when raising/lowering corners.

Cvars.name: nav_show_continguous
Cvars.help: Highlight non-contiguous connections

Cvars.name: nav_max_view_distance
Cvars.help: Maximum range for precomputed nav mesh visibility (0 = default 1500 units)

Cvars.name: nav_update_visibility_on_edit
Cvars.help: If nonzero editing the mesh will incrementally recompue visibility

Cvars.name: nav_show_potentially_visible
Cvars.help: Show areas that are potentially visible from the current nav area

Cvars.name: nav_selected_set_color
Cvars.help: Color used to draw the selected set background while editing.

Cvars.name: nav_selected_set_border_color
Cvars.help: Color used to draw the selected set borders while editing.

Cvars.name: nav_update_lighting
Cvars.help: Recomputes lighting values

Cvars.name: nav_update_blocked
Cvars.help: Updates the blocked/unblocked status for every nav area.

Cvars.name: nav_check_floor
Cvars.help: Updates the blocked/unblocked status for every nav area.

Cvars.name: nav_select_overlapping
Cvars.help: Selects nav areas that are overlapping others.

Cvars.name: nav_show_area_info
Cvars.help: Duration in seconds to show nav area ID and attributes while editing

Cvars.name: nav_snap_to_grid
Cvars.help: Snap to the nav generation grid when creating new nav areas

Cvars.name: nav_create_place_on_ground
Cvars.help: If true, nav areas will be placed flush with the ground when created by hand.

Cvars.name: nav_draw_limit
Cvars.help: The maximum number of areas to draw in edit mode

Cvars.name: nav_solid_props
Cvars.help: Make props solid to nav generation/editing

Cvars.name: nav_create_area_at_feet
Cvars.help: Anchor nav_begin_area Z to editing player's feet

Cvars.name: nav_drag_selection_volume_zmax_offset
Cvars.help: The offset of the nav drag volume top from center

Cvars.name: nav_drag_selection_volume_zmin_offset
Cvars.help: The offset of the nav drag volume bottom from center

Cvars.name: nav_shift
Cvars.help: Shifts the selected areas by the specified amount

Cvars.name: nav_world_center
Cvars.help: Centers the nav mesh in the world

Cvars.name: nav_select_radius
Cvars.help: Adds all areas in a radius to the selection set

Cvars.name: nav_check_file_consistency
Cvars.help: Scans the maps directory and reports any missing/out-of-date navigation files.

Cvars.name: nav_slope_limit
Cvars.help: The ground unit normal's Z component must be greater than this for nav areas to be generated.

Cvars.name: nav_slope_tolerance
Cvars.help: The ground unit normal's Z component must be this close to the nav area's Z component to be generated.

Cvars.name: nav_displacement_test
Cvars.help: Checks for nodes embedded in displacements (useful for in-development maps)

Cvars.name: nav_generate_fencetops
Cvars.help: Autogenerate nav areas on fence and obstacle tops

Cvars.name: nav_generate_fixup_jump_areas
Cvars.help: Convert obsolete jump areas into 2-way connections

Cvars.name: nav_generate_incremental_tolerance
Cvars.help: Z tolerance for adding new nav areas.

Cvars.name: nav_area_max_size
Cvars.help: Max area size created in nav generation

Cvars.name: nav_check_stairs
Cvars.help: Update the nav mesh STAIRS attribute

Cvars.name: nav_test_stairs
Cvars.help: Test the selected set for being on stairs

Cvars.name: nav_subdivide
Cvars.help: Subdivides all selected areas.

Cvars.name: nav_gen_cliffs_approx
Cvars.help: Mark cliff areas, post-processing approximation

Cvars.name: nav_save_selected
Cvars.help: Writes the selected set to disk for merging into another mesh via nav_merge_mesh.

Cvars.name: nav_merge_mesh
Cvars.help: Merges a saved selected set into the current mesh.

Cvars.name: nav_edit
Cvars.help: Set to one to interactively edit the Navigation Mesh. Set to zero to leave edit mode.

Cvars.name: nav_quicksave
Cvars.help: Set to one to skip the time consuming phases of the analysis.  Useful for data collection and testing.

Cvars.name: nav_show_approach_points
Cvars.help: Show Approach Points in the Navigation Mesh.

Cvars.name: nav_show_danger
Cvars.help: Show current 'danger' levels.

Cvars.name: nav_show_player_counts
Cvars.help: Show current player counts in each area.

Cvars.name: nav_remove_jump_areas
Cvars.help: Removes legacy jump areas, replacing them with connections.

Cvars.name: nav_delete
Cvars.help: Deletes the currently highlighted Area.

Cvars.name: nav_delete_marked
Cvars.help: Deletes the currently marked Area (if any).

Cvars.name: nav_flood_select
Cvars.help: Selects the current Area and all Areas connected to it, recursively. To clear a selection, use this command again.

Cvars.name: nav_toggle_selected_set
Cvars.help: Toggles all areas into/out of the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_store_selected_set
Cvars.help: Stores the current selected set for later retrieval.

Cvars.name: nav_recall_selected_set
Cvars.help: Re-selects the stored selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_add_to_selected_set
Cvars.help: Add current area to the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_add_to_selected_set_by_id
Cvars.help: Add specified area id to the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_remove_from_selected_set
Cvars.help: Remove current area from the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_toggle_in_selected_set
Cvars.help: Remove current area from the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_clear_selected_set
Cvars.help: Clear the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_begin_selecting
Cvars.help: Start continuously adding to the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_end_selecting
Cvars.help: Stop continuously adding to the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_begin_drag_selecting
Cvars.help: Start dragging a selection area.

Cvars.name: nav_end_drag_selecting
Cvars.help: Stop dragging a selection area.

Cvars.name: nav_begin_drag_deselecting
Cvars.help: Start dragging a selection area.

Cvars.name: nav_end_drag_deselecting
Cvars.help: Stop dragging a selection area.

Cvars.name: nav_raise_drag_volume_max
Cvars.help: Raise the top of the drag select volume.

Cvars.name: nav_lower_drag_volume_max
Cvars.help: Lower the top of the drag select volume.

Cvars.name: nav_raise_drag_volume_min
Cvars.help: Raise the bottom of the drag select volume.

Cvars.name: nav_lower_drag_volume_min
Cvars.help: Lower the bottom of the drag select volume.

Cvars.name: nav_toggle_selecting
Cvars.help: Start or stop continuously adding to the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_begin_deselecting
Cvars.help: Start continuously removing from the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_end_deselecting
Cvars.help: Stop continuously removing from the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_toggle_deselecting
Cvars.help: Start or stop continuously removing from the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_select_half_space
Cvars.help: Selects any areas that intersect the given half-space.

Cvars.name: nav_begin_shift_xy
Cvars.help: Begin shifting the Selected Set.

Cvars.name: nav_end_shift_xy
Cvars.help: Finish shifting the Selected Set.

Cvars.name: nav_select_invalid_areas
Cvars.help: Adds all invalid areas to the Selected Set.

Cvars.name: nav_select_blocked_areas
Cvars.help: Adds all blocked areas to the selected set

Cvars.name: nav_select_obstructed_areas
Cvars.help: Adds all obstructed areas to the selected set

Cvars.name: nav_select_damaging_areas
Cvars.help: Adds all damaging areas to the selected set

Cvars.name: nav_select_stairs
Cvars.help: Adds all stairway areas to the selected set

Cvars.name: nav_split
Cvars.help: To split an Area into two, align the split line using your cursor and invoke the split command.

Cvars.name: nav_make_sniper_spots
Cvars.help: Chops the marked area into disconnected sub-areas suitable for sniper spots.

Cvars.name: nav_merge
Cvars.help: To merge two Areas into one, mark the first Area, highlight the second by pointing your cursor at it, and invoke the merge command.

Cvars.name: nav_mark
Cvars.help: Marks the Area or Ladder under the cursor for manipulation by subsequent editing commands.

Cvars.name: nav_unmark
Cvars.help: Clears the marked Area or Ladder.

Cvars.name: nav_begin_area
Cvars.help: Defines a corner of a new Area or Ladder. To complete the Area or Ladder, drag the opposite corner to the desired location and issue a 'nav_end_area' command.

Cvars.name: nav_end_area
Cvars.help: Defines the second corner of a new Area or Ladder and creates it.

Cvars.name: nav_connect
Cvars.help: To connect two Areas, mark the first Area, highlight the second Area, then invoke the connect command. Note that this creates a ONE-WAY connection from the first to the second Area. To make a two-way connection, also connect the second area to the first.

Cvars.name: nav_disconnect
Cvars.help: To disconnect two Areas, mark an Area, highlight a second Area, then invoke the disconnect command. This will remove all connections between the two Areas.

Cvars.name: nav_splice
Cvars.help: To splice, mark an area, highlight a second area, then invoke the splice command to create a new, connected area between them.

Cvars.name: nav_crouch
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'must crouch in this area' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_precise
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'dont avoid obstacles' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_jump
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'traverse this area by jumping' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_no_jump
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'dont jump in this area' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_stop
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'must stop when entering this area' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_walk
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'traverse this area by walking' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_run
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'traverse this area by running' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_avoid
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'avoid this area when possible' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_transient
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'area is transient and may become blocked' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_dont_hide
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'area is not suitable for hiding spots' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_stand
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'stand while hiding' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_no_hostages
Cvars.help: Toggles the 'hostages cannot use this area' flag used by the AI system.

Cvars.name: nav_strip
Cvars.help: Strips all Hiding Spots, Approach Points, and Encounter Spots from the current Area.

Cvars.name: nav_save
Cvars.help: Saves the current Navigation Mesh to disk.

Cvars.name: nav_load
Cvars.help: Loads the Navigation Mesh for the current map.

Cvars.name: nav_use_place
Cvars.help: If used without arguments, all available Places will be listed. If a Place argument is given, the current Place is set.

Cvars.name: nav_place_replace
Cvars.help: Replaces all instances of the first place with the second place.

Cvars.name: nav_place_list
Cvars.help: Lists all place names used in the map.

Cvars.name: nav_toggle_place_mode
Cvars.help: Toggle the editor into and out of Place mode. Place mode allows labelling of Area with Place names.

Cvars.name: nav_set_place_mode
Cvars.help: Sets the editor into or out of Place mode. Place mode allows labelling of Area with Place names.

Cvars.name: nav_place_floodfill
Cvars.help: Sets the Place of the Area under the cursor to the curent Place, and 'flood-fills' the Place to all adjacent Areas. Flood-filling stops when it hits an Area with the same Place, or a different Place than that of the initial Area.

Cvars.name: nav_place_set
Cvars.help: Sets the Place of all selected areas to the current Place.

Cvars.name: nav_place_pick
Cvars.help: Sets the current Place to the Place of the Area under the cursor.

Cvars.name: nav_toggle_place_painting
Cvars.help: Toggles Place Painting mode. When Place Painting, pointing at an Area will 'paint' it with the current Place.

Cvars.name: nav_mark_unnamed
Cvars.help: Mark an Area with no Place name. Useful for finding stray areas missed when Place Painting.

Cvars.name: nav_corner_select
Cvars.help: Select a corner of the currently marked Area. Use multiple times to access all four corners.

Cvars.name: nav_corner_raise
Cvars.help: Raise the selected corner of the currently marked Area.

Cvars.name: nav_corner_lower
Cvars.help: Lower the selected corner of the currently marked Area.

Cvars.name: nav_corner_place_on_ground
Cvars.help: Places the selected corner of the currently marked Area on the ground.

Cvars.name: nav_warp_to_mark
Cvars.help: Warps the player to the marked area.

Cvars.name: nav_ladder_flip
Cvars.help: Flips the selected ladder's direction.

Cvars.name: nav_generate
Cvars.help: Generate a Navigation Mesh for the current map and save it to disk.

Cvars.name: nav_generate_incremental
Cvars.help: Generate a Navigation Mesh for the current map and save it to disk.

Cvars.name: nav_analyze
Cvars.help: Re-analyze the current Navigation Mesh and save it to disk.

Cvars.name: nav_analyze_scripted
Cvars.help: commandline hook to run a nav_analyze and then quit.

Cvars.name: nav_mark_walkable
Cvars.help: Mark the current location as a walkable position. These positions are used as seed locations when sampling the map to generate a Navigation Mesh.

Cvars.name: nav_clear_walkable_marks
Cvars.help: Erase any previously placed walkable positions.

Cvars.name: nav_compress_id
Cvars.help: Re-orders area and ladder ID's so they are continuous.

Cvars.name: nav_build_ladder
Cvars.help: Attempts to build a nav ladder on the climbable surface under the cursor.

Cvars.name: wipe_nav_attributes
Cvars.help: Clear all nav attributes of selected area.

Cvars.name: nav_clear_attribute
Cvars.help: Remove given nav attribute from all areas in the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_mark_attribute
Cvars.help: Set nav attribute for all areas in the selected set.

Cvars.name: nav_chop_selected
Cvars.help: Chops all selected areas into their component 1x1 areas

Cvars.name: nav_simplify_selected
Cvars.help: Chops all selected areas into their component 1x1 areas and re-merges them together into larger areas

Cvars.name: clear_debug_overlays
Cvars.help: clears debug overlays

Cvars.name: g_debug_constraint_sounds
Cvars.help: Enable debug printing about constraint sounds.

Cvars.name: phys_timescale
Cvars.help: Scale time for physics

Cvars.name: phys_penetration_error_time
Cvars.help: Controls the duration of vphysics penetration error boxes.

Cvars.name: physics_highlight_active
Cvars.help: Turns on the absbox for all active physics objects

Cvars.name: physics_report_active
Cvars.help: Lists all active physics objects

Cvars.name: surfaceprop
Cvars.help: Reports the surface properties at the cursor

Cvars.name: physics_constraints
Cvars.help: Highlights constraint system graph for an entity

Cvars.name: physics_debug_entity
Cvars.help: Dumps debug info for an entity

Cvars.name: physics_select
Cvars.help: Dumps debug info for an entity

Cvars.name: physics_budget
Cvars.help: Times the cost of each active object

Cvars.name: air_density
Cvars.help: Changes the density of air for drag computations.

Cvars.name: sv_bonus_challenge
Cvars.help: Set to values other than 0 to select a bonus map challenge type.

Cvars.name: player_debug_print_damage
Cvars.help: When true, print amount and type of all damage received by player to console.

Cvars.name: givecurrentammo
Cvars.help: Give a supply of ammo for current weapon..

Cvars.name: sv_clockcorrection_msecs
Cvars.help: The server tries to keep each player's m_nTickBase withing this many msecs of the server absolute tickcount

Cvars.name: sv_playerperfhistorycount
Cvars.help: Number of samples to maintain in player perf history

Cvars.name: ch_createjeep
Cvars.help: Spawn jeep in front of the player.

Cvars.name: ch_createairboat
Cvars.help: Spawn airboat in front of the player.

Cvars.name: mp_disable_autokick
Cvars.help: Prevents a userid from being auto-kicked

Cvars.name: sv_unlag
Cvars.help: Enables player lag compensation

Cvars.name: sv_maxunlag
Cvars.help: Maximum lag compensation in seconds

Cvars.name: sv_lagflushbonecache
Cvars.help: Flushes entity bone cache on lag compensation

Cvars.name: sv_showlagcompensation

Cvars.name: m_customaccel

Custom mouse acceleration:
0: custom accelaration disabled
1: mouse_acceleration = min(m_customaccel_max, pow(raw_mouse_delta, m_customaccel_exponent) * m_customaccel_scale + sensitivity)
2: Same as 1, with but x and y sensitivity are scaled by m_pitch and m_yaw respectively.
3: mouse_acceleration = pow(raw_mouse_delta, m_customaccel_exponent - 1) * sensitivity
